report.title: Unauthorised CocoaPods Auth via Token Leakage & HTTP Header Injection
Able to see highest poll result without voting or view result
debug.log File Exposure that exposes (user/████) username and password at █████████

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A debug log file exposure vulnerability was discovered that allowed sensitive information to be viewed. The debug log file contained a username and password, which could enable unauthorized access to the application if exploited. To address this, restricting access to the debug log file and changing all exposed credentials was recommended.

report.title: subdomain takeover at █████████

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A subdomain takeover vulnerability was discovered. The subdomain had been pointing to an inactive third-party resource, allowing an attacker to claim the resource and take control of the subdomain. The attacker was then able to serve arbitrary content on the subdomain.

report.title: **"CSRF Vulnerability in Royal Canin Website Allows Attackers to Change User Profile Picture at my.royalcanin.pt"**

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site request forgery vulnerability was discovered in a website which allowed an attacker to change a user's profile picture through exploitation of this vulnerability. By crafting a malicious request resembling a legitimate user action, an attacker could replace a victim's profile image without their consent or knowledge. This undermined the integrity of user accounts and exposed users to potential reputational and privacy risks. The vulnerability has since been addressed.

report.title: reflected xss in https://wordpress.com/start/account/user

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability was exploited in the account user page of a website. By appending malicious JavaScript code to the redirect URL parameter after authenticating, reflected XSS could be triggered when users clicked continue on the account user page.

report.title: Buffer overflow and affected url:-https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/master/docs/examples/hsts-preload.c

cwe: Cleartext Storage in a File or on Disk

report.title: OAuth2 client_secret stored in plain text in the database

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: An OAuth2 client secret was stored in plain text in a database. If accessed without authorization, this would have allowed the client secret to be easily read, enabling impersonation of any OAuth2 client.

report.title: Yet Another CASB Integration Takeover of Active Integrations

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was found in a cloud access security broker's Microsoft integration where an attacker could bypass confused deputy protections. By manipulating the casing of a tenant UUID, a new integration could be created that surfaced sensitive customer information. This issue was addressed by disallowing multiple integrations per tenant.

report.title: CVE-2023-42663: Apache Airflow: Bypass permission verification to view task instances of other dags

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: In Apache Airflow versions before 2.7.2, a vulnerability existed that allowed authorized users with access to read specific DAGs to view task instance information from other DAGs by bypassing permission verification. Upgrading to Apache Airflow version 2.7.2 or newer addressed this issue.

report.title: Subdomain takeover on one of the subdomain under mozgcp.net

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A subdomain takeover was reported on one of the subdomains under mozgcp.net due to a dangling DNS record. Content was able to be hosted under the subdomain by researchers who had registered the record.

report.title: Subdomain takeover on one of the subdomain under mozgcp.net

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A subdomain takeover was reported on one of the subdomains under mozgcp.net due to a dangling DNS record. Content was hosted under the subdomain by researchers who registered the record.

report.title: Subdomain takeover on one of the subdomain under mozgcp.net

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A subdomain takeover was reported on a subdomain under mozgcp.net due to a dangling DNS record that had been registered by researchers, allowing them to host content under the subdomain.

report.title: Password of talk conversations can be bruteforced

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: The password of talk conversations could be bruteforced by adding the password as a parameter on the GET request of the frontpage instead of sending a POST to the authentication endpoint. This allowed bypassing brute force protection of public talk conversation passwords.

report.title: Memcached used as RateLimiter backend is no-op

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered where the Memcached cache was used as the backend for rate limiting. This resulted in cache entries being wiped and rate limit attempts and bruteforce protection being bypassed.

report.title: CSRF + XSS REFLECT

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site scripting vulnerability was found in two parameters on websites for Daimler Truck, which could allow execution of arbitrary JavaScript in users' browsers if exploited through cross-site request forgery. The vulnerability was reported to the company along with steps to reproduce it and was demonstrated through a proof of concept exploiting both parameters.

report.title: Bypass R2 payment screen

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: The R2 payment screen bypass vulnerability was reported. Due to insufficient access control checks, it had been possible to enable the R2 subscription without having a valid payment method stored. Cloudflare addressed the issue by implementing stricter access controls around subscription enablement.

report.title: YAML schema injection risk in Swagger UI via schema_url parameter at developers.cloudflare.com
Cross-Site Request Forgery

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site request forgery vulnerability was found in an application. Requests were not validating cross-site request forgery tokens, allowing an unauthorized user to perform administration functions by inserting valid session cookies into arbitrary requests. This could have enabled an attacker to create administrator accounts or share files without authorization.

report.title: Google Docs link in JS files allows editing & reading survey information

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A Google Docs link was discovered in JavaScript files on a website allowing editing and reading of survey information. The link provided access to edit a survey and view some users' emails and responses.

report.title: [███████] Information disclosure due unauthenticated access to APIs and system browser functions

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: Multiple vulnerabilities were exposed in a Jira Server instance allowing unauthenticated access to APIs and system browser functions. This included the ability to run arbitrary code on an internal network server. Project categories, resolutions, and usernames could be listed without authentication. Remediation involved restricting anonymous access to affected endpoints starting in Jira 9.0 using feature flags or disabling flags for earlier versions.

report.title: User automatically logged in as Sys Admin user on https://███/Administration/Administration.aspx

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered where any user could be automatically logged in as a system administrator on a web application. This allowed unrestricted access and privileges could be abused to modify user privileges, add or delete users, and upload files, jeopardizing the integrity of the application. The issue was remediated by requiring authentication before granting administrative access.

report.title: fetlife.com/signup_step_profile expose access_token of mapbox.com
CRLF injection leads to internal XSS on PangleGlobal

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site scripting vulnerability was discovered due to carriage return line feed injection on the file_name parameter of a PangleGlobal endpoint. This could have allowed JavaScript code execution in a user's browser through reflected cross-site scripting. The vulnerability has since been resolved.

report.title: Title: Deceptive Manipulation of HTTP to HTTPS with VPN in Burp Suite
Stored xss at https://█.8x8.com/api/█/ID

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was reported where stored data could be modified to introduce malicious JavaScript that would execute in a victim's browser when the data was retrieved. The issue was isolated to a randomly generated identifier. The development team addressed the issue by implementing additional access controls and sanitizing user input to prevent the introduction of unauthorized code.

report.title: Authenticated path traversal to Stored XSS and Denial-of-Service

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: An authenticated path traversal vulnerability was discovered that could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service by reading files from restricted directories. This vulnerability also enabled an attacker to determine which files existed on the server. Additionally, a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability existed where emoji description text was not properly sanitized before display, allowing injection of malicious script. To mitigate these issues, file path parameters should be sanitized and emoji text should be encoded to prevent script execution.

report.title: Bypass report submit restriction/ban using the API key

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered that allowed banned researchers to submit reports through API keys, bypassing reporting restrictions. By creating an API key after an account was banned from submitting reports, a researcher could still submit reports to programs without restrictions, potentially sending a high volume of reports.

report.title: Security bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/oauth/authorize - CRLF Header injection via "redirect_uri" parameter

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site scripting vulnerability was found in the "redirect_uri" parameter of the OAuth authorization endpoint at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/oauth/authorize that allowed arbitrary HTTP response headers to be injected through carriage return and line feed encoding in the parameter value, potentially enabling session manipulation or open redirection attacks.

report.title: Password and mail address stored unencrypted in memory - Rockstar Game Launcher

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: User credentials were stored unencrypted in memory for a short time during the login process for a game launcher application. The credentials could have been retrieved by dumping application memory after login. This issue has since been resolved to no longer expose passwords in memory.

report.title: CVE-2023-40611: Apache Airflow Dag Runs Broken Access Control Vulnerability

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was found that allowed unauthorized modification of details in Apache Airflow dag runs. Users with dag view authorization could alter configuration parameters and start dates in some dag run details by modifying values when submitting notes. This issue was addressed in Apache Airflow version 2.7.1.

report.title: Unauthorized Access to Deleted Interviews on Glassdoor Platform

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: Unauthorized access to deleted interviews on a career platform was possible through an RSS endpoint that has since been deprecated.

report.title: Race condition in up voting and down voting

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A race condition vulnerability was discovered in the up voting and down voting functionality of an online dictionary website. Multiple requests from parallel threads to vote on the same term could be accepted, allowing a user to vote more than once and potentially misrepresent the reputation of terms.

report.title: Possibility of Deface through translation tool - www.mozilla.com

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered where credentials for a third-party translation tool used by Mozilla websites were publicly disclosed. This exposed access to translation management functions and internal documents. The issue was reported and it was advised that the disclosed passwords be changed to prevent unauthorized access and translation changes.

report.title: RCE  on ingress-nginx-controller via Ingress spec.rules.http.paths.path field

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was exploited that allowed arbitrary files to be written and executed on the ingress-nginx-controller pod through the manipulation of Ingress resource specifications. By configuring log formats and locations, malicious configurations could gain remote code execution capabilities on the pod. This provided attackers with ingress privileges the ability to execute commands and potentially compromise the cluster.

report.title: Flickr API key leaked in GitHub commit

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: An API key was leaked in a GitHub commit. The key granted access to a Flickr account, allowing unauthorized access to uploaded photos and metadata without permission.

report.title: IDOR vulnerability in unreleased HackerOne Copilot feature

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: An unreleased feature of HackerOne's Copilot was vulnerable to IDOR through a GraphQL mutation. By supplying another user's conversation ID, an attacker could have deleted conversations in the Copilot interface before this issue was addressed.

report.title: Code inject via nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/permanent-redirect annotation

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: The nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/permanent-redirect annotation was not properly sanitized when passed into the nginx configuration, allowing code injection from users able to create ingress objects. This allowed commands to be run on the ingress-nginx-controller pod and the Kubernetes API to be accessed to retrieve secrets or config maps, posing a risk to cluster security and data. The vulnerability has since been addressed.

report.title: Improper Access Control allows OTP bypass

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered that allowed the one-time password requirement to be bypassed when directly accessing the admin log download endpoint. This could have enabled users within the organization to access admin logs without verifying their identity. The issue was resolved after being reported.

report.title: Search input is vulnerable for XSS in qa.td.com and dev.td.com

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A cross-site scripting vulnerability was exploited in the search input on two domains for a financial institution. Malicious code could be executed in a victim's browser or users redirected to malicious websites by entering crafted search queries. Cookies and other sensitive data may have been at risk.

report.title: Accessing apps protected via ZT's Access when user account is deleted/disabled even after clearing user session/seat

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: Server-side validation checks were implemented after access to SaaS apps protected via ZT's Access could be gained when a user account was deleted or disabled by preserving metadata of the Access JWT and using another active user account within the same organization, despite lacking proper privilege. The vulnerability was resolved by Cloudflare Engineering through necessary validation on the server side.

report.title: New Search Feature: Search for non-public words in limited disclosure reports

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered that allowed an attacker to search for words in limited disclosure vulnerability reports on HackerOne and see if the word existed in the full report, rather than just the limited disclosure portion. This could potentially allow secrets contained within a full report to be leaked by an attacker performing iterative searches.

report.title: Blind SSRF on https://my.exnessaffiliates.com/ allows for internal network enumeration

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A blind stored server-side request forgery vulnerability was discovered in an endpoint of a website. This allowed internal network details to be disclosed by making requests to internal IP addresses and ports. With escalation, further inspection of the internal network could have been possible. The issue was mitigated by not returning error messages when requests contained blacklisted contents.

report.title: xss reflected - pqm.tva.com

report.title: Potential Spoofing Risk through Firefox Private Relay Service

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A potential spoofing risk was identified in the Firefox Private Relay service. Adversaries were able to send spoofing emails to users by leveraging the service. The design of the service allowed these spoofing emails to bypass security measures and reach the target inbox. This was due to the re-composition of the email and modification of the "From" header, which invalidated DKIM and ARC headers. Recommendations were made to address this vulnerability, including authentication checks, ARC validation, and avoiding modification of the original email.

report.title: RCE of Burp  Scanner / Crawler via Clickjacking

report.title: Stored XSS in plan name field (Acronis Cyber Protect)

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A stored XSS vulnerability was identified in the plan name field of Acronis Cyber Protect. report.title: XSS from Mastodon embeds

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: An XSS vulnerability was discovered in the IRCCloud web client that allowed an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the web client. This was possible due to the default embedding of Mastodon toots, which could be manipulated to include a malicious `javascript:` URL. By tricking a user into viewing the embedded content, an attacker could obtain the user's session token and potentially compromise their account.

report.title: (CVE-2023-32006) Permissions policies can impersonate other modules in using module.constructor.createRequire()

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered in Node.js that allowed permissions policies to impersonate other modules using the module.constructor.createRequire() function. This could bypass the policy mechanism and enable the loading of modules outside of the defined policy. The vulnerability affected all users using the experimental policy mechanism in Node.js versions 16.x, 18.x, and 20.x. The issue has been fixed in the latest security releases.

report.title: Context isolation bypass via nested unserializable return value

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered in Electron that allowed for a bypass of context isolation. This meant that code running in the main world context in the renderer could access the isolated Electron context and perform privileged actions. The vulnerability was fixed in versions 25.0.0-alpha.2, 24.0.1, 23.2.3, and 22.3.6.

report.title: (CVE-2023-32003) fs.mkdtemp() and fs.mkdtempSync() are missing getValidatedPath() checks

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: The fs.mkdtemp() and fs.mkdtempSync() functions in Node.js were found to be missing getValidatedPath() checks, allowing for a path traversal attack. This vulnerability could be exploited to create arbitrary directories.

report.title: (CVE-2023-32004) Permission model bypass by specifying a path traversal sequence in a Buffer

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: A vulnerability was discovered in Node.js version 20, specifically within the experimental permission model. It allowed for a bypass of the permission model by specifying a path traversal sequence in a Buffer, leading to improper handling of file permissions.

report.title: OpenSSL engines can be used to bypass and/or disable the Node.js permission model

report_generated_content.hacktivity_summary: Arbitrary OpenSSL engines could be loaded in Node.js 20, bypassing and disabling the permission model. This allowed for the execution of arbitrary code, unaffected by the permission model.
